str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Just as, as, even as. From hos and per; just as, i.e. Exactly like.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
Knowledge, doctrine, wisdom. From ginosko; knowing, i.e. knowledge.
And, even, also, namely.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
(a) speed, haste, (b) diligence, earnestness, enthusiasm. From speudo; 'speed', i.e. despatch, eagerness, earnestness.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From perissos; to superabound, be in excess, be superfluous; also to cause to superabound or excel.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
This; he, she, it.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
